title: For Sale/Trade:  Steel core 7.62x54r for AR parts
postcontent:
Starting up a 5.56 AR build, and hoping to trade off some of my stash of ammo for the Mosin to make that happen. I have a couple stripped lowers on the way, so I'm still in need of everything else. LPK's, uppers in every stage of completion, pmags, 5.56 etc. I'm looking for a fairly basic low frills 16-18" carbine configuration. Reliability is more of a concern than pure accuracy, this is intended as a home defense sort of rifle so minute of badguy to 150 yards or so is all I need. Basic single stage triggers are fine, and preferred over fancy match grade ones. Rails I can take or leave etc. Barrel wise all I need is chromed or melonited, at least 1:9 and 1:7 greatly preferred.

I have around 2000 rounds available, I honestly haven't counted in a long time. I believe it's all Czech light ball, but I may have a sealed can of something else. Will verify all that tonight. Happy to do it as a group or in smaller lots. This is what I have, although newer production I believe. http://62x54r.net/MosinID/MosinAmmo011.htm

Also willing to sell for $0.40/round ie $8 per box of 20.

title: For Sale:  Trijicon ACOG TA31RCO-M4CP
postcontent:
The TA31RCO is an Advanced Combat Optical Gunsight (ACOG) designed for the M4 and M4A1 weapon system (14.5 barrel). It provides the shooter with quick target acquisition at close combat ranges while providing enhanced target identification and hit probability out to 800 meters utilizing the Bullet Drop Compensator. The TA31RCO incorporates dual-illumination technology using a combination of fiber optics and self-luminous tritium. This allows the aiming point to be always illuminated without the use of batteries. The Tritium illuminates the aiming point in total darkness, and the fiber-optic self-adjusts reticle brightness during daylight according to ambient light conditions. This allows the operator to keep both eyes open while engaging targets and maintaining maximum situational awareness. Designed to the exact specifications of the United States Marine Corps, the unique reticle pattern provides the shooter with quick target acquisition at close combat ranges while providing enhanced target identification and hit probability out to 800 meters utilizing the Bullet Drop Compensator.

title: For Sale/Trade:  WW2 Hungarian Mannlicher M1943 8mm Mauser Rifle
location: south side of city, Chicago, Illinois, Chicago, Illinois
postcontent:
Hello, I have a Hungarian Mannlicher M1943 rifle in 8mm. The rifle is in the original condition as it was recovered and taken home after the war. Rifle is chambered in the 8mm Mauser caliber. It has the Hungarian army shield stamp and the 43M marked on the receiver. Im not a history expert but what i do know is that these were made in Hungary prior to german occupation for their troops. Once Germany captured Hungary, the made the factory switch the rifle to 8mm and start using various Mauser parts on it such as the mag plate and stripper clips etc. at which time it got the 43M stamp. The action is very similar and very smooth as a Mauser but slightly different. Most of these guns were stamped with nazi eagles etc. but some like this one was not and this makes it slightly more rare. Anyway, down to the nitty-gritty. Rifle action, bolt and mag plate, etc are all in really good shape for their age, only minor wear from use. The barrel and receiver are in good shape too but do show signs of blue wearing and minor cosmetic flaws such as tiny scratches or dings etc. but for being over 60 years old its in great shape. Id say blueing is about 80% or so, but im not appraising expert, thats just my opinion. The stock is in bad shape...its warped from age, and its missing the top handguard piece that mauser type rifles are known for. All metal is there such as sling swivels, butt plate and screws, screws etc. Screw heads are worn though, and bayonet mount is missing. Otherwise its a solid piece that does shoot and operate well. It could be restored with the addition of a new stock or used as a parts rifle as it is intact parts wise. Its a real piece of WW2 history that isnt very common from what i have seen/read. I just have no real use or desire for it and would like to sell/trade it to someone who does. Includes a box and a half of 8mm ammo. More pics available upon request. Contact me with any questions or offers........

Asking price: $300.00 OBO

text : REDACTED
email: REDACTED

title: For Sale:  BARRETT MODEL 95 BOLT ACTION REPEATING RIFLE SYSTEM .50 BMG 29", 5 ROUND WITH ACCESSORIES
postcontent:
Match-grade, chrome chambered fluted barrel. Bullpup design. Sling attach points, air/watertight carrying case, one five round magazine, 1913 accessory rail, and detachable adjustable bipod.


The Model 95 may weigh in at a smaller class, but packed into its convenient bullpup design are the intense power of a magazine-fed weapon, the pinpoint accuracy of a bolt action rifle and the effortless functionality of a perfectly designed machine.

This compact rifle offers the velocity and accuracy of a 29-inch barrel in a shortened overall length of just 45 inches. Adopted for military use, the Model 95 is made for those who refuse to sacrifice accuracy for power.

Its buttplate, magazine well and trigger housing are unitized, helping to stiffen the steel lower receiver. the steel upper receiver is reinforced with an M1913 optics rail and supports the chrome-chambered, fluted barrel. the two can be assembled in less than 60 seconds without the use of tools.

Model 95 in action
The bolt carrier itself is a study in innovation. Designed for speed, reliability and safety, it slides effortlessly on machined-smooth parallel rails, transporting a large bolt that locks into the barrel extension on three lugs. The firing pin is driven by dual firing pin springs designed for consistency and lightning-quick lock time.

The only thing more impressive than the Model 95 rifle’s performance is the comfort with which it can be used. The ergonomically designed rifle rests on a lightweight front bipod and an optional adjustable rear monopod. This careful attention to usability allows the shooter to quickly and accurately fire five rounds, reload with a fresh magazine and get back on target in seconds.

The Model 95 provides the discerning shooter with bolt-action accuracy and magazine fed rate of fire.

The Model 95 is what you expect in a Barrett. Innovative. Purposeful. Rugged.


Barrett Model 95 Features 

Model 95 Optics Rail	
M1913 STEEL OPTICS RAIL, PARALLEL WITH BORE

M95 Magazine	
5 ROUND MAGAZINE

M95 Chamber	
CHROME CHAMBER

Additional Features:
Ultra-fast lock time
No iron sights
Large bolt handle
Sling attach points
Pelican case
Detachable adjustable bipod legs
Owner’s manual.

title: For Sale:  Colt 9mm AR-15 with Pulsar 4.5x Digital Night/Day Sight and Side-mounted Reflex Sight
postcontent:
For those who saw the previous listing of these items, I've relisted to add information that hopefully answers the most common questions I've been asked. See Q & A below.

This is a Colt AR-15 chambered for 9mm in excellent condition. It comes with a Pulsar 550 Digital sight. It also comes with a SightMark mini reflex sight mounted on the side of the pulsar for quick target acquisition. Includes the original, unopened Colt goody bag with two 32 round magazines, manual, cleaning kit and strap. The scope includes a case, manual, allen wrench and unopened video out cable. I'm also throwing in 4 rechargeable AA batteries for the scope, 2 additional 32 round magazines and 500 rounds of ammunition.

This gun is a native 9mm rifle with a low maintenance, 1 piece bolt. It is cycled by inertia alone--no gas tube, thus the gun is easier to maintain. With a decent suppressor and subsonic ammo the sound of the bolt is louder than the sound of the shot.

Q & A

Usage? The gun has had 2-3 thousand rounds through it. It's seen no hard use and has only been fired at the Isaak Walton shooting range. It has and still does work flawlessly. The digital sight has been used less than 2 hours.

If it's so great, why are you selling it? I have another one to which I've added a suppressor and after shooting that one, I'll probably never want to shoot this one again. The digital sight is good and has some advantages over the traditional night sight--it's lighter, much more flexible and there is no real limit to how far you can see. It has no warm up or cool down time like the traditional night sight and you won't be blinded if a light turns on while using it. It really excels at very low light viewing over a distance of 20 - 200 yards and more. However, the system I wanted was for operating at short distance, in doors, in total or near total darkness. The digital sight works in that situation with its built in infrared light, but the magnification is a little too high for quick target acquisition. Also, it requires some work with settings to get a good image in different situations so I went with simplicity.

How well has it been maintained? I'm studying gunsmithing and have a good grasp of how to care for a gun. I have a workbench and a cleaning rest. I use brass cleaning jags and Tipton nylon cleaning rods. It has never been completely disassembled. 

I will consider selling the gun and the sight separately if I get offers for each. I'd bee looking for $750 for the gun and $600 for the sight.

- Battery cap and latch are eliminated and replaced with a simple O-ring, tethered cap; better sealing is achieved
- Average battery life at brightness level 12 is roughly 600 hours
- Side buttons with an adjustable, locking, quick detach lever for easy attachment and removal

Take your .22 rifle to a whole new level with the Slide Fire® TAC-22. title: For Sale/Trade:  S&W 681-1 .357 magnum revolver
postcontent:
This is a Smith & Wesson Model 681-1 .357 magnum stainless steel revolver. They have been out of production for at least a couple of decades. It is a fixed sight "fighting revolver" built on the L-frame. It's similar in configuration to a Model 64 except it takes .357 magnums or .38 specials and has a beefier frame to it. It is square butt.
This gun was exported and reimported by CAI in Georgia VT and the barrel has been marked this way. It isn't very noticeable and does not affect function at all. It's a shooter in great shape, just a few handling marks and a turn ring. It doesn't appeal to have been shot very much at all. I added a Crimson Trace laser grip, LG-307 designed for this gun. The grip was made last year, is in perfect condition and is still under warranty.  $495 for the gun and Pachmayr grip, $625 for gun, Crimson Trace laser grip and the Pachmayrs. I will sell the laser grip by itself for $150.
